1.16: a minute will reverse. For I have known them all already, known them all: Have known the evenings, mornings, afternoons, I have
1.17: measured out my life with coffee spoons; I know the voices dying with a dying fall Beneath the music from a farther room. So how

1.40: the Fool. I grow old ... I grow old ... I shall wear the bottoms of my trousers rolled. Shall I part my hair behind?   Do I dare
1.41: to eat a peach? I shall wear white flannel trousers, and walk upon the beach. I have heard the mermaids singing, each to each.
1.42: I do not think that they will sing to me. I have seen them riding seaward on the waves Combing the white hair of the waves blown
1.43: back When the wind blows the water white and black. We have lingered in the chambers of the sea By seagirls wreathed with seawe
1.44: ed red and brown Till human voices wake us, and we drown.
